hive_lesson.title: 1237 Freaks and Animals
hive_lesson.description: Julia and Todd discuss certain lifestyles.

hive_text_custom.text: So, Julia, let's talk about types of people.
Right, first one, are you a fitness freak?
A fitness freak? I'm fairly fit but I'm not a freak. No, I'm not a fitness freak, no.
So you exercise but it's not like you do it all the time?
No, and I do some unhealthy stuff as well. I like to drink and I'm a former smoker and yes, no I'm not a fitness freak.
Right. I think a fitness freak is like somebody who does it, who exercises
I indulge in bad stuff too so no I'm not a fitness freak.
OK, so that leads us to the next question. Are you a party animal?
Not any more. I'm too old now.
When you were younger, you were a party animal?
I think, yeah, that was probably the type that I most fitted into.
Nice. I was never a party animal.
Yes, I was pretty wild when I was younger.
So you used to drink, smoke, stay up late?
Yeah. All that and more, yeah.
Oh, nice, that's cool. OK, next one would be do you know anybody in your family who's a couch potato?
Because I know that you're not a couch potato.
I'm not a couch potato, no. My brother sometimes demonstrates couch potato traits.
He likes to play video games and stuff like that and he'll spend a lot of time watching movies and so he does spend a lot of time
compared to me. He makes me look like a fitness freak, I guess, because he doesn't do so much exercise.
Right. And so for people listening a couch potato is somebody who watches a lot of TV and sits on the couch.
Spends a lot of time on the couch, yeah.
Well, how about the similar personality trait of the bookworm? Are you a bookworm?
A bookworm? No, but I think my husband's probably a bookworm.
He spends a lot of time reading books. He reads very fast so he gets through a lot of books.

Yeah, he's a very fast reader and he has to read. He has to have a book with him all the time. He cannot, a waiting room or on a train or any situation where you've just got to sit around, he cannot do it if he doesn't have a book.

Yeah. You know I live alone and that's a terrible trait that I have. I cannot sit and eat and just eat without something to occupy my attention. I have to read or I have to be like watching something on the computer and if I go to a waiting room or anything like that or I'm on a plane I'm the same. I have to have something to read.
You see I can't read on transport because I get sick. It makes me sick, it makes me
Yeah. So I don't have a habit of reading on a train. A bus or a car, oh my God no, I can't read. No way but my husband reads everywhere all the time.

hive_lesson_quiz.question: 1) What are unhealthy habits Julia has or had?
5) What does Todd use to occupy his attention?

hive_text_custom.text: A fitness freak is someone who exercises compulsively.
If you do something 'compulsively,' you have an            irresistible desire to do it. It's like something inside of            you tells you that you must do it. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples: It's hard to relax around him, because he compulsively              does things with his hands.She is always compulsively touching her hair.

hive_text_custom.text: Here, 'tame' is the opposite of wild. Instead of being a            crazy party boy, Todd was calmer and more relaxed. Notice            the following:

hive_vocab.examples: Her boyfriend is a little too tame for her.She's usually kind of wild at bars, but she was tame              tonight.

hive_text_custom.text: Did you come home in the wee hours of the morning?
The 'wee hours' of the morning would be the time when the            sun starts coming up. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples: I'm exhausted because I was awake until the wee hours of              the morning finishing this paper last night.He always stays out until the wee hours of the morning              when he goes out with his friends.

hive_text_custom.text: He spends a lot of time sedentary compared to me.
You are 'sedentary' when you don't move around very much            or do physical activity. Watching TV is a sedentary action.            Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples: After breaking her leg, she had to be completely              sedentary for six weeks.He has gained a lot of weight since he started a more              sedentary job.

hive_text_custom.text: I have to have something to read. It drives me nuts.
Something that 'drives you nuts' irritates you or makes            you feel crazy. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples: It drives me nuts the way he talks with food in his              mouth.This song drives him nuts, so I always play it when he              is around.

hive_text_custom.text: I can't read on transport because I get nauseous.
When are 'nauseous, ' you feel like you want to vomit.            Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples: This medicine will keep you from getting nauseous in the              car.I think I ate too many sweets, because I'm feeling very              nauseous now.

hours of the morning every day, you will always be tired.
